xml:
STS-51C Mission: Department of Defense Space Shuttle: Discovery Launch Pad: 39A Launched: January 24, 1985 at 2:50:00 p.m. EST Landing Site: Kennedy Space Center, Florida Landing: January 27, 1985 at 4:23:23 p.m. EST Mission Duration: 3 days, 1 hour, 33 minutes, 23 seconds Orbit Altitude: 220 nautical miles Orbit Inclination: 28.5 degrees
This was the first mission dedicated to the Department of Defense. The U.S. Air Force Inertial Upper Stage (IUS) booster was deployed and met the mission objectives.
Crew consisted of Commander Thomas K. Mattingly, II, Pilot Loren J. Shriver, Mission Specialists Ellison S. Onizuka, James F. Buchli and Payload Specialist Gary E. Payton.
